intro: Sageretia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered sageretia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer months. Sageretia laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
